page.title: 15LOCAL NEWS (1)
page.content: Camelford needs more public toilets because of coaches that stop in the town local councillors heard last week. Mayor Michael Gee said that since a seven foot high traffic barrier was placed at the entrance to the Churchfield Car Park coaches were unable to stop to allow passengers to use the toilets in Enfield Park . They now parked up the other end of town where toilets were needed. The town council decided to take the matters up with North Cornwall District Council. A former Mayor told this week how his peaceful stroll by a river was rudely interrupted. Mr. Bill Perry was out walking his dog when he turned to find a bull behind him. P.T.O.
